text: What if we could successfully minify a lot more CSS files, but you could no longer view the unminified version outside the design manager. Would it be worth it?
I'd say so. I mean, ideally I'd like to see the full version if ?hs_debug=True, but the more minification the better, and I do 90% of CSS debugging in design manager previews anyway.
I rarely use hs_debug, but I also usually do most of my work in local scss files
Chrome and Firefox can both unminify assets, anyway
Yeah, hsDebug wouldnâ€™t return unminified assets. Do you feel the same way about JS?
What's the timeframe that an address added to the url mapper takes effect?

Also, if you add a redirect from a non-www domain page (like <http://example.com/old-page>) to another page on the site thats www (like <http://www.example.com/new-page>), will it do this? It seems like in order to fully do it, i need to do it with only the www version as it automatically redirects non-www to www like so (sorry for all the w's)
- <http://www.example.com/old-page>
- <http://www.example.com/new-page>
